articles.title: Cuban embassy officials visit Korean Revolution Museum
articles.content:
Cuban embassy officials visit Korean Revolution Museum 
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- Esteban Lobaina Romero, Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK, and embassy officials visited the Korean Revolution Museum on Thursday on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
 Being briefed on the fact that President Kim Il Sung led the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle to achieve the historic cause of the country's liberation, the guests looked round mementoes and materials.    
 After the visit the ambassador said that the revolutionary spirit of Mt. Paektu is cherished in the hearts of the Korean people.

DPRK Government statement distributed at UNSC
articles.content:
DPRK Government statement distributed at UNSC 
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- The Jan. 10 DPRK Government statement on declaring its withdrawal from the NPT, a letter the DPRK Foreign Minister sent to the president of the UN Security Council in this regard and the Jan. 21 detailed report of the KCNA were distributed at the UNSC as its official document s/2003/91 on Jan. 31.

articles.title: U.S. schemes to deploy more forces in Pacific
articles.content:
U.S. schemes to deploy more forces in Pacific 
    Pyongyang, February 7 (KCNA) -- U.S. Defense Secretary Rumsfeld reportedly signed an order to get more military planes ready to be deployed in the Pacific.
 In this regard CNN said 24 B-52 and B-1 bombers were ordered to be deployed on Guam island and other planes for gathering information, reconnaissance and surveillance would be ready to be dispatched to other pacific areas.    
 This is a military move targeted against the DPRK, CNN added.
